content.description:
Tricky climbing up a short steep wall.

Start at a left-slanting pillar feature which is passed directly straight up.  Continue up with a few thank goodness holds.
content.protection: 3 lead bolts to bolted anchor.  Anchor shared with Local Color.
content.location:
Bolted face just left of the crack corner on the left side of the Red Arête.

Right of Local Color.

content.description:
Short fun route with both slab and steep features all on the same, short route!

Move onto the slab.  Stretch up to the steep orange plate (left of the gray streak).  Clip a couple more bolts and head to the bolted anchor.

Somewhat cryptic. A lot of climbing for the lack of distance!
content.protection: 3 or 4 lead bolts to bolted anchor (shared with the Old Ten-A route).
content.location:
Right hand side of the flat slab which leads to a steep finish wall.

Right of "no name" route which climbs left of the roofy area.  Left of the Old 10a route.

content.description:
Slab approach to the short, right leaning layback crack.

Bit of a sting in the tail which is dispensed quickly.
content.protection: Top rope or a selection of stoppers and small to medium sized cams.
content.location: To the right of the upper protruding block right of the Red Arête.

content.description:
The corner crack just left of the Red Arête.

Some awkward movement.  Dive in deep for better holds in the early on.  Finish on the more flush crack up high.
content.protection: Selection of mid to big cams and medium to large stoppers.  Or...top rope.
content.location:
The obvious left side corner crack of the Red Arête.

Right of the Old Ten-A.
